sect1.title: Virtual Knock-Out
sect1.para: This annotator can be used to see how important a single concept is to all possible paths contained in a network. The first column entitled "cid" gives the concept identifier. The second column entitled "concept name" indeed gives the concept name.

The third column entitled "extension" gives the number of paths that would be extended if a concept was added. The fourth column entitled "deletion" gives the number of paths that would be deleted if this concept was deleted. The fifth column entitled "nochange" gives the number of paths that would not be shortened/extended if this concept was deleted.

The sixth column entitled "score" gives the score computed by the knock-out annotator for this concept based on the results in the last three columns. The OVTK resizes the concepts based on this score.

The seventh column entitled "diameter" gives the length of the longest shortest path in the subgraph which contains the concept. The eighth column entitled "components" gives the number of connected components (connected graphs) that would be left over after the deletion of the concept.
After clicking on "Annotate Graph" and clicking anywhere in the visualisation window
After sorting the result table of the annotator by "score" (the sixth column), clicking on the highest score and the zoom in icon in the tool-bar

The yellow circle indeed represents the concept which would change this particular cluster of concepts the most. It is also possible to export the results to an CSV file by using the "Export results" button.
